Rouliniella species are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. The leaves are usually alternate and heart-shaped, while the stems are twining or trailing. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant flower colors.
